message:
Thanks a lot, Stephen.. I have read your article and it's really helpful for me.

Looks like I'm really late to the party.. may I ask you something in ConfigureAwait(false) ?  
I understand "to not capture the current context" by calling ConfigureAwait(false), but in this case what actually does the completed task with ConfigureAwait(false) remember for the current context?

If I have controller/business components and do not have any views(UI), in this case is it suggested to call ConfigureAwait(false) everywhere, because I don't need to remember UI context ?
